1112111221112221112211222111211111211112.content:
Despite a momentary reaction by Suzu, she soon got over it and in a minute was walking that way. On the way to the Maid’s quarters, Suzu noticed at once that it wasn't just Mika’s waistline that had changed. For such a dreary day, it made the inside of the manor look dark and scary, more so since all the lights were turned off and in some places, white sheets were thrown over furniture in an attempt to reduce the amount of dusting needed…a sign of things gone awry since her holiday.

Entering the annex where they maids all lived, they turned into the first room on the left which belonged to the two maids of the house slept. Inside everyone was waiting her arrival.

“Suzu!” Mimi catapulted from her seat and bear hugged the returning vacationer “We missed you so much!!”

Looking above the head of the household chief, one quick look around the room told her everything Suzu needed to know. It was rare enough all of them in the same room – except dinner of course – but the looks on their faces told her how glad they were she was back, and that she had certainly come back to a real mess. Anya was leaning on the back wall and had lost some of the weight she had put on since their new master, Mimi was still remarkably the same, and Kate…

“What happened to Kate?!” Suzu at once panicked. Kate was sound asleep, but with a large cast around her right leg. Her weight also looked reduced by a few kilograms.

“She broke it about a month after you left” Anya started to explain “After which, master ordered everyone go on a stupid diet”

“A Diet?”

“He’s gone crazy!” Mimi finally cried out “he thinks it was his fault and so he cut my food budget to stop us overeating!”

“What do you mean?” Suzu said confused as she took a closer look at the leg “That doesn't sound like him at all, what happened?”

“Well…I guess you could say things didn’t hold together in while you were gone” Anya started to summarize “it all started when Master started blaming himself for you running away…and then he started distancing himself from all of us…but only after he got swamped by the paperwork and made a big mistake in managing the finances…or something…and then Kate broke her leg…”

“How did she do that?” Suzu asked

“She kind of…ate a lot after you left” Mika started “comfy eating…I think you call it…”

“Okay…” Suzu was finally getting it “And then…”

“And then she got so fat she broke the damn ladder and broke her leg” Anya finished it off and started getting angry “and then our stupid master overreacted by putting us on this diet and exercise routine because he is afraid we'll have a heart attack or something...”

Suzu needed to sit down. She dropped down on Anya’s bed and looked up at Mimi and Mika, both with expressions between worry and relief that Suzu was back to hopefully sort things out. Suzu was quickly regretting every second of her vacation.

“So what else do I need to know?”

“Just master is stupid, crazy, paranoid and stupid” Anya replied “And I don't know how long we can put up with this, if you can’t turn him around…”

By the looks of everyone else, it had been an idea they had already considered, though they also didn't sound like they really wanted to do it. Without Suzu around things had not just gone awry, they had borderline collapsed…and now everyone was looking to her to fix the problem.

1112111221112221112211222111211111211112.content:
You had been at it all morning, but as much you denied it, you really needed Suzu to help you out, even if you wanted to clean up this mess before she got home in a week (was it a week, you’ve lost track), it was pretty obvious right now that by the looks of things, the best thing you could do was damage control.

“This is crazy…” you speak to yourself as you scribble out an incorrect math equation “I pray to which ever saint covers transportation that they bring me back Suzu a week early…”

Just then the door knocked.

“Yes?” you looked up wondering if Anya was again trying to find out what was going on.

You really don't want her finding out how bad the finances are right now…calling you an idiot will be the least of your worries.

“It’s me, Suzu…”

“Thank you…” you start to mutter before speaking louder “Please, come in!”

Suzu entered followed by Anya and in a few seconds stood in front of you..

“Welcome back…” you start to speak while shaking Suzu's hand “you don't know how glad I am to see you”

Suzu’s visual reaction to your desperate comment told her volumes about your apparent mental state and she didn't mince words after she saw the piles of papers and books behind you. After about five seconds of observations, she finally asked the most obvious questions.

“What happened?” Suzu started “And how bad?”

You have to admit that she isn’t a fool. Even with the tan, you can tell her mind has already started working again in a problem solving mode. You want to tell her exactly what's going on, but first you want some privacy.

“Anya?” you turn to Suzu’s escort and your – hopefully still after all of this is over – girlfriend.

“Yes?”

“Brew a pot of coffee with the usual condiments and bring it up here…” you instruct her with the tone of an order.

Anya sighed at the defeat at being ordered out and away from finding out what was going on, but before she left; Anya was given an additional order.

“Anya? When you’re done with that; please inform the others I want to speak with all of you in the dining room…in about…give it…2 hours or so, okay?”

“Of course” Anya responded with more animated this time before leaving the study.

Suzu waited until the door was closed before speaking.

“Well you got your head maid out of the study now, now are you going to tell me what happened?” Suzu asked

You nod and started to explain.

It all started when she; the Manor’s resident medic – and also the designated secretary for the paperwork – had left for her holiday. You had decided to make an honest effort to do the work without her assistance. But unfortunately, you hadn’t really known what you were getting into until it was too late. At first it looked pretty simple; manage the stock portfolio, read the minutes of company meetings that your uncle had invested in, and then write up your buy, sell and other business transaction orders where you then – and previously only did – affix your signature to before faxing it out.

But despite the best of intentions, even you had to admit now that you had screwed up. Judging by the reports that kept coming in; you were now fairly sure that you had more than likely destroyed the fortune your uncle had created through some very bad choices. What made it even worse was your attempt to hide this problem from your maids, all of whom depended on you for their wellbeing. You explained that despite what you had said to Anya and the others, the real reason why you cut food budget to only the basics, wasn’t over your reaction to Kate’s injury, but as you explained carefully…you had no idea if you could even afford their – judging by their collective eating habits, expensive – monthly food budget or even the electricity bill anymore.

When queried on why you would do such a thing, you went on to explain that it was a habit from the old days; from before you became master of this manor. You have plenty of experience with living with very little cash during tough times and living on a diet of instant noodles until the next paycheck was typical for you once. Unfortunately, you never really had others to worry about as well and in your hope to not alarm the others, you kept it all quiet.

“Why didn’t you just call me?” Suzu asked, after hearing the fantastic story of your own creation.

“You were unreachable, and I thought I could fix this before you came back…” you said honestly “and given what happened before you left, how could I call you back early?”

Even you had to admit that you were quite stubborn to believe you could fix this problem you caused. Now having told the one person you knew who might fix this, you waited for her reaction to see what would happen.

“How bad off are we?” Suzu asked

“I have no idea…I don’t know how much we have, I don’t know what we own, I really don’t know anything” you finally admit to yourself

Suzu sighed for a moment and decided to take action, she smiled as she stood and walked around to where you sat. if there was one thing you had been hoping for all week it was that assuring smile and the words that she was about to say.

“Well, let’s find out...” Suzu said as she stood “…before you have to talk to the others”

1112111221112221112211222111211111211112.content:
You didn't expect things to go to hell after Suzu left. Sure, she was a nurse and all, but you didn't expect there to be too much chaos as a result. Surely not, but, in the first week you sent out a help-wanted add for a replacement, chaos reigned supreme in your humble abode. The first thing you noticed was that Kate had, alas, fallen into a depression. She you seldom saw her, and when you did, there were streaks of tears running down her cherubic, chubby cheeks. You wanted to hug her, to make her just feel better about herself, about the world, about everything, but, alas, nothing you did cheered her up. She simply returned to sobbing in her room, no doubt upset at the prospect that she, potentially, hurt Suzu.

"Poor girl," Anya mumbled, sighing under her breath as she bit into a half-cooked cookie, almost spitting it out in shock as she tasted the poorly beat flower, "Yuck! This is all grainy and--wait, did Mimi use an actual flo--she did, didn't she!?"

In her own guilt, Mimi had started to crumble apart as well. Her cooking, once superb, now bordered on the fine line between inedible and grotesque. For the past few days, you have secretly ordered take-out for all the staff, even Mimi, though she was unaware who was paying for all this food. Kate refused to eat it initially, but soon gave in after the third day of her mournful fasting.

Suzu's return was the only thing that could truly bring everyone together again, but a replacement for the nursing position needed to be found on a temporary basis. Finally, however, you received a bite. In fact, multiple. You had a call late in the night, which forced you to leave Anya's pudgy side on the mattress as you as you placed the reciever to your ear. "Hello?"

"Hello, I'm calling in response to the add I saw in the paper regarding the nursing position?"

"Oh!" you stammered, jumping up, eagerly, "Yes, yes! Uh, the position is still open, if you want to join in, or--"

"Heehee, well, yeah, I do want the position, and yes, I would love to fill the spot. My name is Betsy Franklin, but, uh, here's the thing: I need to work with two other people, since I'm currently in training, otherwise I legally wouldn't be able to--"

"You're all hired. That's fine," you said, unconcerned about money, "We just need the position to be filled as soon as possible. When can you start?"

"Tomorrow morning! Thanks so--"

"Don't worry about it."

You break away in leiu of checking on Kate, leaving the tour to Anya
1112111221112221112211222111211111211112.content:
Your eyes flutter open as you greet the new day ahead of you; one with three new doctors to help even things out in the household. Without Suzu around to mediate (and in no small part the depression that had encircled due to her absence), things had definately gone to hell in a handbasket around the estate. The accounting was a wreck, apparantly Suzu acted as a safety net for your fatal mathematical errors, and you had no idea what to do about the strange fungus that had grown underneath the stairwell. The house was even P. O.'d, no question about it, your days had been foggy and muggy for the past week and facilities were constantly breaking down; last week, Mimi nearly electrocuted herself when the electric stove short-circuited!

Yup, it really took three women to take Suzu's place (no pun intended). You never realized just how much of a vital role she played in your day-to-day life around here; these three months were certainly going to be long ones. But, today seemed like it was going to be a good one. So without much hesitation, you bounce out of your bed and quickly change into your best casual attire to greet your expected hired help...

As soon as you stepped out of your chambers, you were greeted with the ever-suspicious Anya. With her arms crossed defiantly over her swollen ivory cleavage, your plump redheaded employee/girlfriend looked just a shade more displeased with your behavior than usual. "So, I hear we should be expecting three new members of the household?" she huffed, puffing out her chest as if to stare you down, "So, what, you just wanted some fresh ass to grab around here, is that it?" she demanded, cheeks growing increduously red. "Anya, when have I ever grabbed anyone else's ass around here?" your rebuttle is plain and spoken clearly, but she simply shrugs it off.

"What, are they prettier than me?" she asks, "Skinnier; oh wait, you like 'em big don'cha?" she teases you, now you know she's just playing. "Oh come on Anya, I just want to eat some breakfast." you plead with her after an uncomfortable night of wrestling with a newly emerged spring in your matress. "Oh you're no fun; anxious to get a look at the new doctors are we?" she wraps her soft around yours as she escorts you down the hall and to the stairs. "Anya, please, I'm just hiring a temp for Suzu's holiday." you delegate groggilly as you and your fat girlfriend make your way to the first floor. "And what if they want to stay; do I have to compete with some nerdy chick for my precious chubby-chasing master?" she lays it on thick as the two of you reach the dining hall.

"Anya, you know you never have to compete for my affection." you smile, at that she gives you a soft peck on the cheek. "Good answer, I didn't nearly double my body weight for some scrawny bitch to come in and steal you away."

You open the doors to find the usual melancholy of your dining room; still feeling somewhat empty without the constant coffee-sipping presence of Suzu. Mimi rested a fat cheek in a fat hand, twirling her colored cereal about in her milky bowl solemnly. There was a lightbulb out in one of the electronic chandeliers, something that you would undoubtedly have to get up there and fix yourself (much to your chagrin, Suzu could just do it by standing on the table) Mika seemed to be the only one unaffected by the mysterious depression that had engulfed the household, happilly munching away on her take-out breakfast.

You take your seat at the head of the table, reaching over to grab Mimi's box of cereal and half-gallon of milk to pour yourself a bowl while Anya decided to fend for herself in the wasteland that was Mimi's kitchen. Unfortunately, Kate was absent yet again for breakfast, probably sneaking down and getting something to eat earlier before your arrival... "OH GAWD!!" she hollered girlishly, "SOMETHING IN THAT SINK JUST WINKED AT ME!!" But no one really seemed to notice, each wrapped up in their own preoccupation. You sigh at the recent development, understanding the pain of losing such a close friend...

But before you could even so much as take a sip of your cereal's milky contents, the doorbell rang. Anya hurried out of the kitchen eagerly, much rather faring the new girls than whatever atrocities Mimi had left half-cooked in her battlezone. In her current apparal, no one would willingly believe that this porker in the lime-green tee and gray sweatpants was the head maid, you had to chuckle slightly at that as you decided to follow her to the front door. You watched as Anya visibly squirmed in her tight outfit, pale creamy flesh bulging out all over the place. "IT'S NOT FUNNY, STUPID!!!" she slapped you in the back of the head just at the door, where her demeanor instantly changed as she greeted the three newest members of the household...

"Hey, guys?" you catch the meager attention of your two remaining staffmembers, "Can I have your attention please?" Mika and Mimi complied readilly, but with a certain lack of enthusiasm. "I think that's about as good as their gonna get." Anya quipped as she examined the dour look on the fat womens' faces. You couldn't help but agree with her silently as you continue uninterrupted; "Our new medical staff came today, so let me introduce Betsy, Veronica, and Kara, who will be acting as our temp doctor during Suzu's absence."

The three women each had their own way of introducing themselves, Betsy was the obvious energetic, though lacking in height, enthusiastic of the group who seemed absolutely enthralled at simply being there. Veronica seemed... enthusiastic enough, but her creased black eyebrows definately said that she wasn't near used to smiling this much. And Kara seemed somewhat familiar, tall and busty with a nice tan. If it wasn't for the bright orange hair and a slightly different nose, you could almost place her as someone you knew before...

"So, take it easy and help them around the house, alright?"

There was a pause...

"I VOULENTEER!!" Mika waved a flabby arm euphorically, "I'll show them all around the house and-"

"Why don't you just come with me and Mr. Public Speaker of the Year here," Anya said coldly, grabbing Betsy by her twig-like arm, "It's just safer that way..."

"Er, um, I think I'd b-better go check on Kate..." You stammered as Anya glared daggers at the tall blonde. "I'm sure Anya will be able to show you around by herself, he he."
